result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J. Welker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.


Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.


Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If agent recommends, attend and successfully complete domestic violence programming/counseling.  Domestic Violence Court.  

Contact with the vicitm to be determined by his agent.  Write a letter of apology to the victim on how this effects the victim and the family.  Agent to pre-approve and determine whether it should be sent.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  Parties received the revocation order and warrant and summary.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended:  16CM12.  9 months jail.  16CF18. 1 year jail.  Credit due.  Attorney Gardner recommended:  16CM12 - 4   months jail.  16CF18 -  90 days  jail.  Credit for 87 days on 16CF18.    Court ordered:  In 16CM12 -  9 months jail.  Credit to be determined.  In 16CF18- 1 year jail.  Credit for 87 days in 16CF18.  Concurrent.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 5, 2016 at 09:10 am.
Sent electronically to Judge Becker on 9/27/16.  JMM
from DOC
DNA Proof of Submission form
Associated with Charge #1
Information filed with the Court.  Reading of the information waived.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Grams.  Plead guilty to felony fleeing in 16CF18.  Dismiss but read in Count 2 for sentencing purposes.  Plead guilty to Battery in 16CM12.   Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.  He understood those warnings.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of felony fleeing in 16CF18 contrary to 346.04(3) Wis. Stats., and Domestic Battery in 16CM12 contrary to 940.19(1) Wis. Stats.  Joint recommendation for: Probation 2 years.  No contact with K.H. unless approved by agent.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  LOA to the victim.  AODA and recommended treatment.  DV programming or counseling.  Participate in DV court if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DNA sample.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation.   Contact with the victim to be determined by his agent.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  LOA to the victim, how it effects her and the family.  Agent to pre-approve. AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to random testing.  DV programming or counseling, if agent recommends.  Participate in DV court if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  DNA sample and surcharge.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Grams.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Grams.  Set for plea/sentencing.

This bond includes cases 16CM12 and 16CF18:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: K.H.  AMENDED 3/3/16.  No contact with K.H. modified to:   No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with K.H.

Status conference at 03-21-2016 03:00 pm.
